thread.title_full: Washington Post‚Äôs new slogan mocked on Twitter

title: Washington Post‚Äôs new slogan mocked on Twitter
text:
The Washington Post unveiled its new slogan this week on its website and social media platforms: ‚ÄúDemocracy dies in darkness.‚Äù The @washingtonpost has a new slogan. And it's‚Ä¶awesome. pic.twitter.com/VFNbSRPtjG 
‚Äî ProPublica (@ProPublica) February 22, 2017 
Kris Coratti, a spokeswoman for the Washington Post, told CNNMoney , ‚ÄúThis is actually something we‚Äôve said internally for a long time in speaking about our mission.‚Äù 
‚ÄúWe thought it would be a good, concise value statement that conveys who we are to the many millions of readers who have come to us for the first time over the last year,‚Äù Coratti said. ‚ÄúWe started with our newest readers on Snapchat, and plan to roll it out on our other platforms in the coming weeks.‚Äù 
Some Twitter users expressed support for the slogan, characterizing it as a summary of the purpose of journalism: The @washingtonpost is sending a message about freedom of the press pic.twitter.com/D76v7b1gch 
‚Äî Bradd Jaffy (@BraddJaffy) February 22, 2017 
https://twitter.com/SunFoundation/status/834242140020568064 This is new. 
And powerful. 
‚Äî‚Ä¶she persisted. üóΩ (@leahmcelrath) February 22, 2017 Winner of the best masthead slogan of the month goes to @washingtonpost for "Democracy dies in darkness" #democracydiesindarkness pic.twitter.com/ogH5btSOku 
‚Äî Wm Binuche (@BillBinuche) February 21, 2017 
Others mocked it as melodramatic: 
‚Äî Eliot Nelson (@eliotnelson) February 22, 2017 Good news everyone. pic.twitter.com/QBxHAAhuqN
